meanings.definition: relating to or caused by an upright or standing position
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the orthostatic exercises would help improve my balance.
meanings.sent2: She felt dizzy when she stood up quickly, a common orthostatic reaction.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to be orthostatic like the flamingo, but it kept falling over.
meanings.sent4: His orthostatic posture made him seem taller and more confident.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated the orthostatic position by standing straight with feet together.

meanings.definition: a sudden drop in blood pressure when standing up
meanings.sent1: After standing up too fast, she experienced an orthostatic episode.
meanings.sent2: Orthostatic can sometimes lead to fainting if not managed properly.
meanings.sent3: The orthostatic surprise caught her off guard during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The doctor monitored his orthostatic closely to prevent any complications.
meanings.sent5: The nurse quickly responded to the patient's orthostatic symptoms to stabilize their condition.

meanings.definition: a test to measure changes in blood pressure and heart rate when moving from lying down to standing up
meanings.sent1: The orthostatic revealed significant changes in his blood pressure readings.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often use orthostatic to assess cardiovascular health.
meanings.sent3: During the orthostatic, he tried not to giggle as the nurse took his measurements.
meanings.sent4: The results of the orthostatic helped the medical team understand his condition better.
meanings.sent5: She practiced deep breathing before the orthostatic to keep her heart rate steady.
